image.altText: A woman wearing a bright pink blazer sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The scrutiny comes after Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro recently went almost seven weeks without holding a press conference in Darwin.

title.children: NT government under fire over lack of transparency, scrutiny avoidance

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: After a month-long trial, Matt Wright was last week found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice by a Supreme Court jury. So, what's next in the case of the celebrity crocodile wrangler?

title.children: Found guilty of hindering chopper crash probe, what's next for Matt Wright?

image.altText: The inside of a museum.

props.synopsis: Exhibits from a significant natural and earth science collection will go into storage as an Alice Springs museum is closed for good.

title.children: Museum of Central Australia closes as visitor numbers fall

image.altText: A young  girl in a pilots uniform standing in front of float plane, holding blonde golden retriever puppy, who has tongue out

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl from the Northern Territory is looking to break a record, as the youngest female to fly around Australia solo. And her golden retriever puppy, Bella, will be joining her for the ride.

title.children: 15yo girl and her puppy embark on record-breaking flight around Australia

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has heard vulnerable Optus customers who were homeless, unemployed or receiving disability payments were wrongfully sold services and products.

title.children: Inappropriate 'pattern of behaviours' from Optus staff revealed

image.altText: Two women sit in a nurses office, the woman in the foreground teaching the second woman.

props.synopsis: Helen Lemach says her job is about building relationships and trust as much as telling people what they can do to change their lifestyles.

title.children: Diabetes educator wins national award for fighting 'silent killer'

image.altText: A man and a woman in running gear stand in front of an Aboriginal flag smiling.

props.synopsis: Charlie Maher has become the first Indigenous man to complete all seven major marathons in the world.

title.children: Indigenous runner grateful for historic world marathon feat

image.altText: An aerial view of the town of Katherine, showing the main street and the roofs of businesses and houses.

props.synopsis: Police say a woman has died of a suspected snake bite in the regional Northern Territory town of Katherine after she collapsed on Monday afternoon and was unable to be revived by paramedics.

title.children: Woman dies of suspected snake bite after collapsing at NT business

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs by night.

props.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man who died after being put in a "bear hug" is suing his Alice Springs disability care provider for negligence.

title.children: Aboriginal man died after carer put him in 'bear hug', family claims

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Documents reveal the scale of carbon pollution leaking from a Darwin LNG tank was like adding 8,300 new cars to the road every year. It is about to be filled again.

title.children: 'Huge' leak from gas plant kept secret from public in 'national scandal'

image.altText: A man kneels behind a white rhino calf.

props.synopsis: Peter Trembath, the subject of the 1990s documentary The Flying Vet, is calling time on a long and adventurous career.

title.children: Once paid with a gold nugget, The Flying Vet calls time on 45-year career

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: As the search for Dezi Freeman continues, former police officers say the public should not be surprised if it goes on for months.

title.children: Former officers say police have the advantage in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Two young boys with white paint stripes under their eyes stand among a crowd. A third pulls the arm of the boy in the middle

props.synopsis: Young Indonesians are taking to the streets to voice their anger at the government and police. This is how the protest turned into a riot.

title.children: 'I feel hopeless for this country': Why Indonesia's youth are rioting

image.altText: Trinity de Lance holds her arms above her to signal the end of her beam routine and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: A report by an international ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached the human rights of a 12-year-old girl who broke her back while training in excruciating pain.

title.children: Ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached 12yo's human rights

image.altText: National Guard troops in camo fatigues stand shoulder to shoulder holding clear shields

props.synopsis: A judge has ruled the Trump administration "wilfully" ignored federal law when deploying National Guard forces during riots in Los Angeles earlier this year.

title.children: Trump illegally deployed National Guard to LA protests, rules judge

image.altText: A man with a white bandage around his head looks neutrally at the camera with green foliage behind him

props.synopsis: Rescuers are still working to try and find those trapped in the rubble of buildings scattered across the country's remote eastern provinces, as international aid trickles in.

title.children: Second quake hits Afghanistan after more than 1,400 people killed, Taliban says

image.altText: Alex de Minaur smiles while holding tennis balls at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur knows he needs a few things to go his way to push "all the way" at the grand slams, and he has finally caught some breaks in New York.

title.children: De Minaur needs a little luck to push further. He's got it at the US Open

image.altText: A bald man with a brown moustache looks at the camera while being handcuffed by police.

props.synopsis: Police charge three men arrested outside the Melbourne Magistrates' Court on Tuesday in relation to an alleged attack on a First Nations protest camp.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell charged over Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: A pair of hangs holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: The class action involves junior doctors who worked at the Royal Hobart Hospital and the Launceston General Hospital during the past six years.

title.children: Class action seeks to compensate junior doctors for 'excessive' overtime

image.altText: Sam with her small baby, smiling in a play area.

props.synopsis: Behind Australia's tug-of-war between office headquarters or working from home, a growing number of employers have found a middle ground, providing the best of both worlds for both their workers and their business.

title.children: A 10-minute commute over 90? Why workers are shifting to shared offices

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: The mother of one of six children who died in the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy says she is devastated by a group's attempt to "block" a beachside memorial. They argue the area is "a place for families to escape the hardships of life".

title.children: Beach no place for 'forced' reminder of jumping castle tragedy, group says

image.altText: A woman wearing a silk green dress is stands in front of a crowd of photographers

props.synopsis: Ms Malle, who described herself in an interview with The New York Times as a "proud nepo baby", is the daughter of actor Candice Bergen and director Louis Malle.

title.children: Vogue names Chloe Malle as Anna Wintour's replacement at US edition

image.altText: A woman in a navy hoodie with a hat standing next to a grey mare next to a dirt track in green grass.

props.synopsis: We visited a commercial horse cloning farm on the outskirts of Sydney to find out just how far the technology has come since Dolly the sheep's birth back in 1996.

title.children: John has cloned dozens of horses on his farm near Sydney

image.altText: A Pakistani police officer wearing a camouflage scarf standing on a road in front of a blue truck and damaged shopfronts

props.synopsis: At least 11 people were killed in an attack in Quetta, while another six security personnel and six militants died in a separate bombing on a paramilitary base in Bannu.

title.children: Pakistan bombings kill dozens in political attacks in Quetta and Bannu

image.altText: A young man with blond hair, fair skin and blue eyes sitting at a table in a dinner suit.

props.synopsis: He is accused of raping four women and has been charged with 28 other crimes, including alleged acts of violence against ex-girlfriends.

title.children: Son of Norwegian crown princess faces trial over rape and assault allegations

image.altText: A man behind the bar pouring a beer from a tap.

props.synopsis: As the manhunt continues for the gunman who allegedly killed two police officers in north-east Victoria, businesses are beginning to feel the impacts.

title.children: Businesses hit by manhunt for alleged Porepunkah gunman call for support

image.altText: Two young people are seen looking solemn as they drive a car.

props.synopsis: While federal agents are patrolling Washington DC under US President Donald Trump's orders, they are also being closely monitored themselves.

title.children: The crew roaming Washington to 'bear witness' to a crime crackdown

image.altText: A woman wearing a bright pink blazer sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The scrutiny comes after Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro recently went almost seven weeks without holding a press conference in Darwin.

title.children: NT government under fire over lack of transparency, scrutiny avoidance

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: Researchers have identified the nine priority areas for social housing builds in Sydney — but there are concerns the Not In My Backyard movement could prove a challenge in community sentiment towards new developments.

title.children: Nine ideal Sydney suburbs for social housing identified in new report

image.altText: Priya and Nades Murugappan stand in front of a body of water.

props.synopsis: The Nadesalingam family's immigration nightmare has been transformed into a work of theatre that will have its world premiere at Brisbane Festival.

title.children: This Aussie refugee family made headlines. Now their story is on stage

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

props.synopsis: Californian parents Matthew and Maria Raine allege ChatGPT provided their 16-year-old son with detailed suicide instructions and encouraged him to put his plans into action.

title.children: OpenAI to add parental controls after teen takes his own life

image.altText: A reef with colourful coral

props.synopsis: The Great Barrier Reef and Torres Strait have seen six bleaching events since 2016, including back-to-back events in 2016-17 and 2024-25.

title.children: Experts sound alarm over under pressure Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: A patio and balustrade that has fallen down an embankment on a beach.

props.synopsis: Residents of one Central Coast beach have gained permission to build a rock wall to protect their homes, while in another notorious erosion hotspot there is still no solution.

title.children: Beachside residents 'sitting ducks' as seawall proceeds for others

image.altText: A gold rush era pub with historic brickwork.

props.synopsis: A historic hotel in the gold rush town of Hill End has closed, with locals saying its condition had deteriorated over the past year.

title.children: Historic 150yo pub no longer pouring tap beer closes in 'poor shape'

image.altText: A fireball erupts in a city crowded with cars and shops, man in forefront running, smoke in the sky.

props.synopsis: This latest attack from Israel is a "significant blow" to the Iran-backed rebel group. But how much has it actually weakened the Houthis?

title.children: Israel has killed 12 senior Houthi figures. Has this weakened the rebel group?
